intro: Gymnadenia commersoniana, commonly known as the Commerson's gentian, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of northern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has a slender, upright stem with few leaves and produces a single, showy flower per stem. Gymnadenia commersoniana is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, moist conditions.
